summary: VectorVFS is a Python package that converts your Linux filesystem into a vector database by leveraging the native VFS (Virtual File System) extended attributes. It supports Meta's Perception Encoders and outperforms other image encoders for zero-shot image tasks. VectorVFS stores embeddings directly alongside each file, eliminating the need for external index files or services. It allows for seamless retrieval of files by embedding similarity and supports flexible embedding models. VectorVFS is lightweight and portable, built on native Linux VFS functionality and requires no additional daemons or background processes.

VectorVFS is a software solution that allows for the storage of data embeddings, such as vectors, directly in the filesystem without the need for an external database. It utilizes extended attributes, a feature supported by many Linux file systems, to store the embeddings in the inode of the file itself. This eliminates the need for creating extra loose files in the filesystem and ensures that the embeddings are directly linked to the file they were embedded in. VectorVFS uses the Perception Encoder for encoding the files and storing the embeddings in the extended attributes. It is a simple, local, and easy-to-use solution for retrieval that was missing in the filesystem before.

A vector database is a type of database specifically designed to process and store vectorized data, which are arrays of numerical values representing points in multidimensional space. Unlike traditional databases that use tables, rows, and columns, vector databases work with vectors, making them ideal for handling high-dimensional data such as those found in machine learning, artificial intelligence, genomics, and geospatial analysis. Vector databases use embedding to convert data into vectors, which can be stored and retrieved quickly. They can be used for various purposes, including searching, clustering, and classification. Vector databases are becoming increasingly important in the development of the future of data storage and retrieval due to their ability to handle complex data sets.

VectorVFS is a Python package that converts your Linux filesystem into a vector database by leveraging the native VFS (Virtual File System) extended attributes. It transforms your directory structure into an efficient and semantically searchable embedding store, eliminating the need for external index files or services. VectorVFS supports Meta's Perception Encoders (PE) and outperforms other image encoders for zero-shot image tasks. It also supports both CPU and GPU, but embedding all items in a large collection of images may take time if not using a GPU. VectorVFS is the first release and is expanding models and data types, currently supporting only Perception Encoders (PE) and images. It offers zero-overhead indexing, seamless retrieval, and flexible embedding support, making it lightweight and portable, built on native Linux VFS functionality.
